name: SNOMEDCTRouteCodes
title: SNOMED CT Route Codes
description: This value set includes all Route codes from SNOMED CT - provided as an exemplar.
copyright: This value set includes content from SNOMED CT, which is copyright Â© 2002 International Health Terminology Standards Development Organisation (IHTSDO), and distributed by agreement between IHTSDO and HL7. Implementer use of SNOMED CT is not covered by this agreement.

designation.value: A route that begins on the surface of the body.
A route that begins on, in or by way of the ear.
A route that begins within a joint.
A route that begins in the vagina.
A digestive tract route that begins in the mouth.
A route that begins in subcutaneous tissue.
An intracolonic route that begins in the rectum.
A route that begins within the channel of a tubular structure or tubular organ.
An oromucosal route that begins beneath the tongue.
A body cavity route that begins within the peritoneal cavity and that has the propensity for absorption via the peritoneal membrane.
A topical route that begins on the skin and has the propensity for systemic absorption via the dermal layer.
A respiratory tract route that begins in the nasal cavity.
An intravascular route that begins within a vein.
An oromucosal route that begins on the moist tissue lining of the cheek within the oral cavity.
A route that begins in the eye region.
An intravascular route that begins within an artery.
An intraosseous route that begins within the marrow cavity of a bone.
A body cavity route that begins within the uterine cavity.
An intrameningeal route that begins within the subarachnoid space in the cerebrospinal fluid, at any level of the cerebrospinal axis, including within the cerebral ventricles.
A route that begins within a muscle.
A route that begins within the urethra.
An intragastric and gastrointestinal stoma route that begins through a surgically created opening into the stomach.
An enteral and gastro-intestinal stoma route that begins through a surgically created opening in the jejunum.
An intragastric route that begins through the nose and into the stomach by means of a tube.
An oral route that begins on or around the teeth or in the teeth.
A route that begins within the canal of the cervix uteri.
An intrasinal route that begins within the nasal sinus.
A respiratory tract route that begins within the trachea.
An intrauterine route that is introduced between the amnion and the chorion.
A digestive tract route that begins in the gastrointestinal tract (from the upper esophagus through the rectum).
An oral and topical route that begins on the gingivae.
An intrauterine route that begins on the inside of the amniotic cavity.
A route that begins within a bursa.
A route that begins within the heart.
A route that begins within a pathologic cavity.
A route that begins in the cervix uteri.
An intra-arterial route that begins within the coronary arteries.
A route that begins within the dermis of the skin.
An intraspinal route that begins within a fibrocartilaginous intervertebral disc.
A route that begins within a localized lesion.
A route that begins within the lymphatic vessels or nodes.
An ophthalmic route that begins within the eyeball.
A route that begins within the pleura or pleural space.
An intraosseous route that begins within the bone marrow of the sternum.
A body cavity route that begins within the bladder cavity.
A route that begins on the eyeball or conjunctiva.
An oral route that begins on the moist tissue lining the oral cavity.
A route that begins within the tissues surrounding a joint.
A route that begins around a nerve or nerves.
An ophthalmic route that begins beneath the conjunctiva.
A route that begins on the surface of mucosal tissue and has the propensity for systemic absorption via the submucosa.
A route that begins inside of the trachea specifically, and does not include the potential administration directly to pulmonary locations.
A route that begins within the bile, bile ducts or gallbladder.
A meningeal route that begins within the space surrounding the dura mater within the epidural space.
An ophthalmic route that begins beneath the orbit of the eye.
An intraspinal route that begins within the cauda equina.
A route that begins within the bone.
A route that begins within the thorax internal to the ribs.
A gastroenteral route that begins in the intestinal tract (within the small and large intestines).
A route that begins within the duct of a gland.
An otic route that begins within the auris media.
An intravenous route that begins within the jugular, subclavian or femoral veins.
A route that begins within the myometrium.
A gastroenteral route that begins through a surgically created opening into the gastrointestinal tract.
An intracolonic and gastro-intestinal stoma route that begins through a surgically created opening into the colon (part of the large intestine measured from the cecum to the rectum).
A route that begins within or around the tissues surrounding the urethra.
A dental route that begins within a portion of a tooth which is covered by enamel and which is separated from the roots by a slightly constricted region known as the neck.
An ophthalmic route that begins behind the eyeball or pons of the eye.
A periarticular route that begins within the articular cartilage.
An intraocular route that begins within the vitreous humor of the eyeball.
A route that begins within the vertebral column.
An intragastric route that begins through the mouth and into the stomach by means of a tube.
A urethral route that begins through the urethra.
A route that begins within a tendon.
An ophthalmic route that begins within the cornea.
A respiratory tract route that begins with direct application to the oropharynx.
An ophthalmic route that begins around the eyeball.
An intrajejunal route that begins through the nose and into the jejunum by means of a tube.
A route that begins through a fistula.
A route that begins through a surgical drain.
An intraocular route that begins in the anterior chamber of the eyeball.
A route that begins next to the uterine cervix.
An intra-articular route that begins within the synovial cavity of a joint.
An enteral route that begins within the duodenum.
An intracranial and intrathecal route that begins within the cisterna magna cerebellomedullaris.
A route that begins within the testicles (male reproductive glands).
A route that begins within the skull.
An intratumor route that begins within a tumor cavity.
A route that begins next to one or more vertebra.
A respiratory tract route that begins within the nasal or periorbital sinuses.
A route that begins through the cervix.
A route that begins beneath a tendon.
A route that begins within the abdomen.
A gingival route that begins beneath the free margin of the gingivae.
A route that begins within an ovary or ovaries.
A route that begins within a ureter.
A route that begins around a tendon.
An intrapulmonary tract route that begins within the bronchus.
A route that begins within the prostate gland.
A route that begins beneath the mucous membrane.
A route that begins within a surgical cavity.
An intraileal and gastro-intestinal stoma route that begins through a surgically created opening into the ileum.
An intravenous route that begins in a peripheral vein.
A route that begins within the periosteum.
An intraesophageal and gastrointestinal stoma route that begins through a surgically created opening into the esophagus.
A route that begins through a surgically created opening into the urinary tract.
A respiratory tract route that begins on the larynx.
A respiratory tract route that begins within the lungs or its bronchi.
A fistula route that begins within a mucous fistula.
An intraduodenal route that begins through the nose and into the duodenum, usually by means of a tube.
A route that begins within a non-pathologic hollow cavity, such as that of the abdominal cavity or uterus.
An intracardiac route that begins within a cardiac ventricle.
An intracerebral and intrathecal route that begins within a cerebral ventricle.
A topical route that begins on the skin and that has the propensity to be absorbed through the skin.
A route that begins within the interstices of a tissue.
A gastroenteral route that begins within the esophagus.
An oral route that begins within the gingivae.
A route that begins with the vascular system.
A meningeal route that begins within the dura.
A route that begins within the meninges.
A gastroenteral route that begins within the stomach.
A route that begins within the dilatable spaces of the corpus cavernosa of the penis.
An intrathoracic route that begins within the pericardium.
An oral route that begins in the tongue.
A route that begins within the liver.
An ophthalmic and topical route that begins on the conjunctiva.
An intrathoracic route that begins within the epicardium.
An intracardiac route that begins in the endocardium.
An intrauterine route for a substance that has the propensity for fetal absorption via the placenta.
An intracranial route that begins within the cerebrum.
An enteral route that begins within the ileum.
A dental route that begins around a tooth.
A meningeal route that begins within the space surrounding the dura mater of the spinal cord.
A route that begins within the breast.
A route that begins within a tumor.
An otic route that begins across the tympanic cavity.
An endotracheopulmonary route that begins through the wall of the trachea.
A route that begins within the respiratory tract, including the oropharynx and nasopharynx.
A route that begins anywhere in the digestive tract extending from the mouth through the rectum.
A route that begins within the epidermis of the skin.
An enteral route that begins within the jejunum.
An enteral route that begins within the colon.
A topical route that begins on the skin or cutaneous wounds and/or nails and/or hair in order to obtain a local effect.
Application of the drugs within a nerve.
A route that occurs outside of the body.
A route that begins with diffusion or accumulation in a tissue or cells.
A route that begins on the surface of a localized lesion.
A route used for extracorporeal hemodialysis where the product interacts with the patient blood through a semipermeable membrane.
A digestive tract route that begins in the intestine (from the duodenum through the colon).
A route that begins within a gland.
A route that begins within the bile duct and pancreatic duct.
An intravascular route that begins within the hepatic portal vein.
A route that begins in the regional surrounding a tumor.
An ophthalmic route that begins in the episcleral space adjacent to the macula.
An intraocular route that begins between the sensory retina and the retinal pigment epithelium of the eyeball.
